Any queries or issues were dealt with quickly and efficiently in a friendly manner. The rooms are bright and very comfortable. The cleaning staff do a wonderful job! As the hotel in on Universal Boulevard the location is nice and quiet but it is only a 2 minute walk through the car park to International Drive and you are close to all the great restaurants. There is an I trolley stop right outside the hotel, which takes you down as far as Universal Studios. Breakfast is included with your stay and is served from 7am-10am. There is a plentiful selection that is constantly replenished right up until 10am. We have stayed in several hotels on International Drive, but would choose the Hampton Inn again because we enjoyed our stay so much. We will be recommending this hotel to any friends who are visiting Orlando in the future. I would be happy to answer any questions anyone may have about the Hampton Inn Hotel. Thank you to everyone at the Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “I truly recommend Hampton Inn Conv. Center - Staff went the EXTRA mile with us”
Reviews.Author: Bell_110110
Reviews.Content: Awesome service. Hotel was cozy and clean. Great location

Reviews.Title: “i love the way you can feel like your at home.”
Reviews.Author: iloveronnier
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing , the rooms were very clean and organized . The food was great , especially the muffins. The feeling of being there feels very much like home, and i liked the managment.

Reviews.Title: “I Like the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bernal97
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. excellence staff and excellence service, is a perfect location for my trip, I like everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: fenby19
Reviews.Content: Stayed with partner and teenage daughter for 2 weeks in October. Ideally situated just off International drive with shops and restaurants less than 5 minute walk away. Most of hotel guests were business people staying to attend conventions at convention centre. This suited us fine as it was really quiet by pool a lot of time just me at pool and there wasnt a lot of screaming kids running about. The hotel offers complimentary tea/coffee and warm cookies throughout the day and breakfast served in lobby area with ample choice from 6-10am. Free internet access which my daughter loved as well. Rooms quite large and very clean. Staff really could not do enough to be of assistance and were all very friendly. If I were to go back to Orlando I would definately stay here again and highly recommend if looking for a good clean hotel in a perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mojacar1
Reviews.Content: Good location, busy but not noisy. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, we requested a fridge and microwave and we had these at no extra cost. We travelled with our daughter, son in law and 20mth old grandaughter and they had put us in adjioning rooms which was very convenient. Beds were very comfortable. The air con was a little noisy but it didnt cause a problem. This was our 3rd time on International Drive and i would recommend this Hotel as really great value for money and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - few points below perfect”
Reviews.Author: rebplum81
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel June 2010 and loved it but felt that there was a couple of things lacking (the cleaning in the room). The staff were very friendly, especially the hunky muscle man on the desk (I should say that my man is bigger incase he reads this ha,ha) There was always plenty of breakfast from hot food to fruit and if you are on your way out you can take a breakfast bag with you. We requested a fridge in the room which was not a problem at no extra charge. the location is perfect as Pointe Orlando is within walking distance and there are plenty of places to eat (Bahama Breeze/ Johnny Rockets/ Millers). We loved the fact that you can take the green route on the I -trolley as it is less crowded and is easier to get to Universal. As I said it was almost perfect but the bedding was not changed in 14 days, my 4 y old made chocolate hands on the bed. and the bathroom floor was lightly mopped so the whole trip there was fluff or something behind the toilet. I could have over looked this and put it down to the cleaner being in a rush if it was 1 day but as it was the whole trip it got to the point where we would come in and the first thing we did was check to see if the dirt was still there - and it was!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Becks78
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from the Hampton Inn and are already saying that we want to go back! The location could not be better, especially for those without a car. There is a choice of 2 I-Ride trolley route stops (one in front & one behind the hotel). Many restaurants and attractions are within easy walking distance on International Drive; just walk through the car park behind the hotel. The rooms were clean and quite large but there wasn't enough wardrobe space unfortunately. The staff were always helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a big bonus for staying at this hotel; there was a lot to choose from and it was nice. Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel couldnt have chosen better.”
Reviews.Author: raggety66
Reviews.Content: Went to orlando in August and stayed in the hampton inn,what a great choice.Had read many reviews about this hotel most were very good so we thought we would give it a go.On a previous visit we stayed at the holiday inn right in the middle of international drive so glad we went to the hamptons this time. When we checked in the hotel was very quiet with many business men staying , we were given a lovely room plenty big enough for 3 of us. Breakfast is available every morning,this can save you quite a lot of money even if you dont eat there every day.The staff were always friendly , with free warm cookies at reception and breakfasts in bags to go, our daughter loved it. The swimming pool was a great place to relax with most of the time it was only me and my daughter there. The hotel is right at the end of International drive which we loved, we were near The Pointe shopping area and a multiplex cinema.There are plenty of places to eat in the area and a supermarket. Went to The Hard Rock Cafe in Universal fantastic as is Harry Potter, well worth a visit. Universal was our favourite of all the parks mainly because our 11 year old daughter was tall enough to go on all the roller coasters (scary).Walt disney is great for younger children. Orlando is action packed ,great fun but absolutely exhausting. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jawsNewport
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Alpha Rooms after reading some really bad reviews on the hotel we had originally booked. The reviews were excellent. We spent three happy weeks in the hotel and cannot fault a thing. We were travelling with two young children so it needed to be safe and comfortable. The front desk staff are all very courteous and very helpful. The rooms are very nice with large comfortable beds. The rooms are very well equipped, ironing board, tea/coffee machine etc with ample storage for a family of four. The rooms were cleaned every day and so were the beds and the housekeeping staff couldn't do enough for us including stripping the bedding when my son was sick! The breakfast was plentiful and includes both hot and cold options; waffles, bacon & egg, cereal, pastries etc with several fruit juice choices and a variety of tea an coffee options. If you were having an early start you could just grab a breakfast bag from the front desk. The pool was quite small but very nice with plenty of loungers and shaded tables and chairs and it was open until 11pm so if you have a long day (as most are with Mr Mouse!) you could still have a dip in the evening. There is complimentary tea/coffee available for 24 hours in reception. There is a guest laundry room which was very handy for a 3 week holiday with two children who are serial spillers! We had a brilliant holiday and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Jums
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Inn on Universal Boulevard in July 2010. Was a very short walk to restaurants and a few shops on International Drive. 15 minutes walk would get you to the main hub of International Drive, but I personally liked the quieter atmosphere of our location. Though quieter, there was plenty of choice of restaurant and shops with Pointe Orlando Mall just 5 minutes walk. The Hotel itself was well kept and reasonably clean (there seem to be a lot of spillages in the hallways - but still acceptable). The maid comes every day and replaces towels and sheets where needed, our room was always left looking really nice. There are ice machines and drink vending machines on every floor, a launderette and a small gym. Reception also sell essentials as well as crisps and snacks. The pool is quire small but we quite enjoyed our time sitting around it having a swim - they provide pool towels too. Anything we asked for at reception was attended to in a courteous and friendly way. It was a ten minute drive to Universal and about 20 minutes to Disney. Sea World is just down the road. The car park at the hotel is ample and there are a few trees to park under to prevent the extra hot steering wheel problem. In July it is very hot with temperature reaching 90+ F every day. We did have a few spots of rain here and there - but nothing to stop us enjoying ourselves. Some rides in the theme parks have to close when there is a threat of lightening - this can be a bit annoying - but understandable. Having free Wi-fi in the hotel and 2 computers meant that the family could still check their facebook etc! We enjoyed stating in this hotel and would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “should be a 4 star hotel - fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: sandyc17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fantastic value. Everything about it was great, including central location (yet quiet) - just a walk through the car park to International Drive - and it was at a nice part of I Drive. The room was big enough, immaculate and maids were in every day. The pool area was fine and big enough and was never very busy anyway. There was a huge choice for breakfast and you could eat between 6 am and 10 am. The only thing that would make this hotel any better was if it had a bar - that was the only thing missing. However, although it states no food or drink at poolside, many people had coolboxes with beer and no-one bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: southernrose_19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while in Orlando. When we got to our room, we found big stains on the carpet, the toilet didn't flush, and the bathtub faucet kept dripping (couldn't stop it). The room was run-down and shabby. We're not ones to complain, but this was pathetic. We went down and told the front desk how unhappy we were with the room, and they gladly moved us to another one. When we reached the door to that one, we found that it was held open by the door latch. We knocked before entering, and no one answered, so we went in and looked around. It appeared that housekeeping hadn't finished with the room. It didn't smell clean like our first room did, and there were absolutely no towels or washcloths in the bathroom. The carpet in this room also had pretty bad stains on it, BUT the toilet flushed and the bathtub faucet didn't leak. We went back down to the front desk and told them about the situation, and they said they'd have towels sent up if we wanted to stay in the room. Not wanting to be "troublemakers," we went along with it. The next morning, we awoke to the sounds of weed wackers right outside our window. Then housekeeping banged on the door around 9:00 wanting to know when we were checking out (check-out time was 11:00). This was just not a pleasant hotel experience, especially for a Hampton Inn. This hotel might be priced a little lower than other Hampton Inns, but there's a reason for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jop2611
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for 2 weeks. The rooms are really lovely, well decorated and plenty of room. The bed was amazing, bigger than a king size, you practically needed a ladder to get on to it!!. The maids serviced the room every day and replenished the bathroom toiletries and towels. The staff at the hotel were all really nice and friendly. They were very helpful and provided excellent customer service. All the hotel floors had an ice and drinks machine. The complimentary breakfast was fantastic. It catered for all dietary needs. Some of the things available were homemade waffles, bagels, cereals and hot food which varied each day. If you don't have time to sit down for breakfast, you can take a breakfast bag and eat it on the way. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk to international drive, so the location was great. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant facility on an evening, this is not required as there are so many different restaurants in walking distant, plus most places do deliver to the the hotel. There was an i trolley stop just outside and it is approx 5minutes drive to the Universal Parks, Wet & Wild, Aquatica and Seaworld. The hotel also offered free safe facilities to keep your passport/money etc secure. In the reception area you can also have free access to the internet. The pool is a nice size for the size of the hotel and it was never overcrowded. There is also clean towels at the pool so you do not need to take your own. The whole hotel is really well kept and very clean. As it is located on Universal Boulevard it is a quiet location but within walking distance of international drive so you get the best of both worlds. This hotel is definitely worth recommending and we will definitely stay here again when we go to Orlando next.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, But staff will not listen to us customers.”
Reviews.Author: jeroldpsmith
Reviews.Content: We came in to enjoy a few days of a well needed vacation. Before we left home we called and requested a room away from all the noise in the hotel. When we arrived we asked the desk clerk the same thing, This did not happen. They put us right next door to a room full of screamin and yelling kids. We always stay at Hamptons because of the top quality staff and hotel.This is the first problem we ever had. But it's been very bad. Our bed is not Hampton quality & if you stayed @ a hampton before, you know. You have a choice of a few more Hamptons in the area. Take my advice, Stay at those. Jerold

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Higgys0
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Hampton Inn and have thoroughly enjoyed it. We were given a no smoking room and had requested a smoking room and there was no problem with changing us. The rooms and the beds were clean and comfortable and housekeeping kept our rooms spotless. The air con is a little noisy but we were so grateful for it as the weather was so hot we couldnt have done without it. The complimentary coffee in the reception area is lovely and drank far more than we should. Breakfast is adequate and would imagine there is something there to suit everyone. The staff on reception were also so helpful when my brother-in-law left his video camera in a taxi we used. They rang the taxi company and the police for him but unluckily he did'nt get it back. The pool was great, not large but was never busy. If you walk at the back of the hotel for approx 200yds you are on I-Drive with all the bars and eateries. I would not hesitate on recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad then good”
Reviews.Author: elevonic
Reviews.Content: I will divide this review into good and bad sections based on our stay which was for 8 nights from 16th may 2010. We were a family travelling from the UK. Bad points:- We arrived at the Hampton Inn relieved we had actually made it as the whole trip looked to be in jeopardy due to the ash cloud air traffic closures which were being forcasted as we departed that weekend. I presented our documents to the duty manager, Alex. After reading the documents he started to say, hmmmm, we have a problem, "we havent got a room for you for the first three nights of your stay"! I asked why and was told that they had a lot of convention attendees booked in. I pointed out that my booking had been made in February, I had emailed the hotel twice to confirm different things, in fact the last email communication was on the 11th May and no problem was notified to me then. He apologised and said we were booked in at the Wyndham and they would be picking up the bill, how generous. I pointed out that the Hampton rate included breakfast and free wifi, did the Wyndham include this? A quick phone call and the answer was no! No offer was made to include for these important to us items. I again said this just wasn't good enough but it was a catch 22, they said they had no rooms so what could we do? As a gesture of goodwill Alex said we could choose something from the sweet shop when we booked in, we were insulted by this and finally headed off to the Wyndham very angry and frustrated. It appears that the Hampton Inn is happy to move a family to accomodate convention attendees. The next day I emailed the hotel managers to complain. When I managed to log on again there was a reply and an apology with the offer of two interconnecting rooms when we booked in. There was also the offer to pick up the cost of breakfast and internet access at the Wyndham, but due to the lack of internet access we were unable to take advantage of this as we received it too late. A message to us at the Wyndham would have been far more sensible, it's not like they didn't know where we were. On the 27th May we received an email from a Guest Assistance Specialist of the Hilton Hotels Corporation with the following "Please allow us three business days to review and resolve this matter" I'm typing this on 16th June and still haven't received any response. Good points:- When we finally checked in we were given two interconnecting rooms, one with a fridge. The rooms were lovely, nicely furnished and very comfortable. The air conditioning is a bit noisy but no worse than lots of places we've stayed ( the best air con we had was at the Royal Pacific Resort which has a centralised system so no noise). Housekeeping kept our rooms nice and provided clean towels when necessary. The wifi in the room was perfectly adequate. In general the hotel is very nice, the lobby and common areas are all of a good quality and nicely maintained. Breakfast consisted of cereals, fruit, bread, rolls etc, and had two hot items per day ie eggs and sausage/burger. This was fine for us and we used it all the days we were there. Coffee etc is available 24 hours a day. The swimming pool is small but nice, and was never crowded all the time we were there. It also gets the sun for the best part of the day as there are no other hotels or buildings in front of it. If you want a hotel rather than a motel then the Hampton should be considered, and this was one of the reasons we chose to stay there, its in a great location, quieter than internation drive and only a minute away from it. Restaurants are on your doorstep, Bahama breeze for example, and point orlando is les than a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Florida923
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the reception - you are greeted with a friendly honest welcome. A very clean hotel, and a nice size hotel. Close to universal and other ammenities. Close for shopping too. The bedrooms are a good size and very comfortable beds. Linen fresh and very clean, pillows lush. The breakfast has some differant choices each day but have the standard foods supplied also. Pool a nice size. The staff are very polite and sort any problems out straight away. A very good price for a very high standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, Clean, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TripTiger
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel to visit various attractions around Orlando other than the theme parks. This hotel is located just off International Drive, and it's an easy walk to multiple restaurants, movie theaters, and miniature golf. I placed a request for the reservation to be on the top floor away from the vending and elevators, and all requests were accommodated. Noting that we were on the top (7th) floor, it was a very quiet stay which was great. We were able to sleep without interruption, making for easier days touring around Orlando. There's no fee for parking, so we had our own vehicle and were able to drive to multiple areas within 15 minutes, including Prime Outlets, Florida Premium Outlets, Millenia Mall, as well as some Disney side attractions (such as Winter Summerland golf). Most guests appeared to be there for the Convention Center (about a mile away) or the Theme Parks. Both are fairly easy from this location, and a sub-$100 price is hard to beat. The staff was very friendly and helpful when we had questions, including getting a refrigerator brought to our room. The breakfast in the morning is complimentary and very good. Plus it switches up a bit every day so that you have some variety, including eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, muffins, cereal, juices, fresh fruit, and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gezzerboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks from 1st May 2010. Staff were always very polite and helpfull when needed. Gotta say whoever the lady is that greats people on reception in the mornings is absolutley gorgeous LOL Anyway hotel is located just off I drive. Its just a 2 min walk out the back of the hotel to TGI, Olive garden and other really nice places to eat. Walgreens is also 2 mins away and is open 24hrs should you need anything .The hotel is located up the nice end of I drive and not down the more commercial end near wet and wild. Breakfast in the morning was a real money saver. Plenty of cerial, cakes, pastries with 2 hot selections each day also. Free coffee available all day and night which we always took advantage of as we came back each night from the parks. Swimming pool was also clean with Free towels always provided by the pool. I really cannot fault this hotel for the money. We nearly stayed at Monumental movieland which when i drove passed it i realised would have been a monumental mistake. All in all a great location and hotel for the money. You wont find better for the money on I drive in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ggmDevonuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid April 2010 for 2 weeks ,this is our third visit to i drive and this was probably the best hotel so far, others were Homewood suites and staybridge suites,which were both good but the Hampton inn was better . The rooms were quite basic but very clean and the beds were extremely comfy with a choice of pillows. The breakfast was good and the staff friendly and helpful. The pool was small but adequete and in the sun all day.I drive is just a short walk through the car park .all in all a great place to stay if you want to be close to everytrhing thats good on i drive

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Daniel2414
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks, 26th April till 10th May. On arrival we checked in and went to our room, to find it was a double, however after asking reception for a king room they moved us once a king became available which was only after 2 nights. Reception staff are friendly and very helpful. The room itself was ideal with one huge bed, flat screen telly, and shower and bath, the shower is excellent. Tea and coffe making facilities are available in the room, however we found it quicker to pop to reception and get one from there as they are ready to pour. The only down side is that the air con in the room may be a bit noisy but you get used to it after a couple days, so there is no probs. Breakfast is included, and you have the choice of ceral, pastries, juices, waffles, a selection of 2 hot dishes which change every day or fruit. We stayed at the hotel to do Disney and Universal. There ae no free shuttles from the hotel, we found out that for a round trip to Disney it was $16 each and for Universal and Sea World I think it was around $9 each, which if you were going a few tmes would add up. We decided to get tickets for the I Trolley, for two weeks for the pair of us it came to $32 which is about Â£24, and is ideal, use it as many times as you want in that fortnight, and it saved us loads. There are plenty of stops outside the hotel, and the I Trolley will take you directly to Sea World and Aquatica. For Universal it will drop you off outside and its a 10 minute walk into the parks. For Disney you will have to transfer to a Lynx bus, that is $2 per person for where ever you want to go, and you get free transfers, so is ideal. The bus service is very punctual and usually pretty quiet. The hotel itself is located between International Drive and Universal Boulivard, it is quiet and a short walk to loads of restaurants and clubs on the I Drive, but at night there is no noise from any of these places. USA today is left outside the door every week day morning, if you need a safe there are none in the rooms, they will allocate you one in a room behind reception free of charge. The pool is great and gets the sun all day, and there is usually plenty of loungers available. There is a small gym available for use, and also two computers in the lobby for internet access, however the hotel does provide free Wi Fi which you can get in the rooms also. All in all not a bad place, certainly not luxurious, but an ideal base from where to explore Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: Joolsandlyla
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after booking through Alpharooms and seeing some of the reviews on here. Only room available on the first night was a smoking so they immediately moved us to the hotel next door and took care of all charges. Checked into our room the next day and were very happy. Location is brilliant for the restaurants at Pointe Orlando and as regulars to Orlando we usually go to Denny's or Ponderosa's etc for breakfast but we ate in the hotel as it was more than adequate. Free wireless internet was very good also.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamatwo
Reviews.Content: we have just arrived back from orlando and have had an excellent holiday hotel is clean and reception were very helpful.breakfast each morning is great so you dont have to go to sizzlers or ponderosa.hotel pool was clean and they supply towel at the pool. the sun was on the pool all day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good staff”
Reviews.Author: DavidRTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two nights for a convention. It is within walking distance so it was very convenient. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are up to Hampton Inn standards - clean, roomy, and fresh. I made the mistake of leaving a sport coat in the closet. When I called to follow-up, they were very friendly and helpful. I will definitely use this property every time I go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Had an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: wycanone
Reviews.Content: We were only there for two nights attending a tradeshow at the nearby convention center. Good location, many good restaurants nearby. The room was clean and quiet, the bed was comfortable. The only issue that was notable was the noise of the room air conditioner. I booked my directly through Hampton (Hilton) online. I got exactly the room I requested. The other reviewers that had issues were booking through consolidators (Hotwire, etc) and I have learned through bad experiences that no matter what they promise, you WILL be given the least desireable rooms. My advice is to always book directly through the hotel. You will often get the same rate deal, and if you take the time to join their frequent guest program (even if you aren't!), any problems will be quickly resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect from Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: edgewater99
Reviews.Content: As a regular to the Hampton Inn chain, I know what to expect. This Hampton does not meet the usual standards. I booked through Hotwire and upon check in was given a smoking room. I returned to the desk and was told that since it was Hotwire, that was the only room available as that is what the hotel sold to Hotwire. I complained and was given a handicapped room. The beds were full not queens, no fridge, and the carpet was stained in the hallway and in the room, ac unit was loud. The location of the hotel and the breakfast were good. The bottom line is that the hotel is a little beat. Next time I will stay in one of the newer hotels in the same area. No way was this a three star per Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Booked 4 months ahead but given poor choice of room”
Reviews.Author: MMouseFan
Reviews.Content: I booked this room in September 2009 through the Orlando Housing Bureau. The only request made was preference for a non-smoking room. Upon arrival I was told rooms were not ready and to return later for a key. I was asked if I would prefer a king-sized bed. I replied it would be fine as long as I still received the convention rate. Upon my later return to get my key I discovered I had been put in a handicapped room, which was not acceptable to me. When asked while checking in earlier if I would like a king sized bed no mention was made of it being a handicapped room. Had that been indicated I would most certainly have refused and requested a standard non-smoking room. I requested a room change and was told the hotel was fully booked. Upon insisting for a room change I was given the option of a smoking room. With such lack of options, I reluctantly chose to take the smoking room and immediately went to purchase a can of Oust spray, turned the air unit as high as possible and have been periodically spraying to make the room tolerable. Given the length of time I had made the reservation and the price charged per night, I should never have been put in a situation of choosing between a handicapped room and a smoking room- neither of which I find acceptable, but I was left with little choice. Hampton Inn and other hotels in the Hilton family of hotels will certainly not be on my list of future hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: AJPOswestry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in August. The staff were very friendly and eager to meet our needs. As we didn't have a car for our stay we used the taxi and shuttle service to Disney, which the hotel provide for a charge of around $30 for a return trip. This was reliable and good value for money. The only downside was that we weren't able to choose our times to return from the parks and this was set at 10pm everyday. This was a shame as we were the only people ever to use the service during the 2 weeks and a bit of flexibility would have been welcomed! The breakfast was good and there was plenty of choice. The rooms were clean and tidy. I liked having the USA Today newspaper delivered to my door as part of the service. As a result this hotel would be our first choice for our next holiday in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Hampton.”
Reviews.Author: julie1Scotland
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old son and I stayed at the Hampton Inn - Orlando Convention Centre from 12th-19th October 2009. This was our 3rd visit to Orlando but the first time we had stayed in a hotel. It was fantastic - rooms spacious, clean, maid service every day, lovely comfy beds. Pool was great for my son after spending a day at the theme parks and was open until 11 p.m. Free breakfast every morning with pastries, toast etc and 2 different hot choices each day. Staff were fantastic and very friendly. Will definately stay at the Hampton Inn again on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Skunky63
Reviews.Content: Just got back home from this hotel, stayed there for 2 weeks, breakfast was included in the price and was very good with lots of choices. Staff were very helpful. We got the use of a safe free for the full 2 weeks. Hairdryer, Iron, Ironing board and coffee maker were all in the room. It was only a short walk through the carparks to International Drive with many restaurants nearby. Would recommend this hotal to all....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: degallo04
Reviews.Content: A really good place to stay for this area. Hotel is top notch. Clean, comfortable and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value, location, and room”
Reviews.Author: Rahrae
Reviews.Content: We are Orlando regulars, but this was our first time staying at this hotel. We will definitely be staying there again in the future! The rooms are quiet--ours was directly across from the elevator, but we never even heard it--and OUR WHOLE FAMILY SLEPT UNTIL 10:00! (With our kids, that is amazing--) The outdoor pool is clean, large, and well-maintained with adequate towels, etc. Chili's delivers to this hotel, and the food was hot and good. There is an in-room gaming system (at cost) for the kids, and a free computer in the lobby. Breakfast was hot, well-stocked, and good. The maid left my daughter's stuffed aminals where she'd put them--looking out a window--which I thought was sweet--I would agree that the front desk staff is NOT welcoming or friendly, but they were 5 minutes of our 50+ hour stay. Side note--if you have young kids and want a roomier room, I would go to the Fairfield Inn off of International Drive--they had larger rooms. But for $79, this is my #1 pick in Orlando--

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ChavBuddy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, it's located on the relatively quiet Universal Boulevard with access to International drive through the parking lot. Our room was clean and spacious. The decor in our room and around the hotel was slightly dated but at the price we paid this is only a very minor gripe. The facilities in the hotel were good with an internet terminal, swimming pool and gym available to guests. The hotel breakfast was a brilliant bonus with a selection of cereals, yoghurts, pastries, muffins, breads, fruits and juices. There were also some hot foods available at breakfast every morning but I found these a little too rich. Having said that I'd definitely give the breakfast an overall thumbs up. Like a previous poster I would recommend the local Millers Ale House , big plates of food food and drinks at extremely low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: yama3803
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the previous reviews. It was our first trip to Orlando and the location was excellent. We were minutes from Sea world and Universal studios and about 15 minutes from Disney. If you take a short walk through the rear of the car park you are on "I DRIVE" with all the bars etc. Pointe Orlanda shopping mall and the cinema are but a few minutes walk away. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were cleaned every day and the bedding and towels were also changed daily. The pool was clean and we practically had it to ourselves. Which was great after a long day at the parks and we found ourselves swimming up to 11 in the night. It is not the plushest of hotels and wont suit everybody, it doesnt have a bar or serve meals. But it does provide a complimentry breakfast and serves cookies in the evening. Highly recommended and would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thuso
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks with a 2 year old and a 11 month old. Nothing for children to do and the breakfast they serve is truly disgusting. We ate out even though it was free. Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay and the staff were very friendly and nice. Wouldn't go back, but it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JemEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fab, its in a great quiet location but only a few mins walk to I-Drive, staff always friendly, nice clean rooms and lovely pool are. Breakfast always plentiful and a great start to the day. Recommend Millers Ale House for dinner, amazing food at great prices. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near International Drive”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeLondon
Reviews.Content: This would our 4th time staying in International Drive and the Hampton Inn is the best hotel we have stayed in. It is well positioned, in Universal Boulevard , which runs parallel with International Drive and has easy access. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are ok with fridge, TV , iron , hairdryer etc. although the beds we thought were small double's. The air con is noisy , but not a problem , just turn it off at night-time. Breakfast was a good extra , cereal , toast, bagels, muffins, Danish pastry's , fresh fruit and two hot dishes, plenty of juice and coffee's. Plenty of it and breakfast area was well serviced. Look out for the fresh cookies in the afternoon...mmm..yum !! The pool was clean and well kept with fresh clean towels on the sunbeds every morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again. Recommend Bhahama Breeze (love it), Millars Ale House just a short walk through the back of car park into International Drive.and Discovery Cove....it's the best day ever !!! you must do it...

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this for the price!”
Reviews.Author: TxKjngrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel and was very impressed. I got a AAA rate of $44 a night plus tax for a room with 2 queen beds plus breakfast. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was better than average for hotels in this range. There were some stains on the carpet but I figure with all the families with children they serve, it's hard to keep the carpet spotless. If I were paying more per night I might complain. I saw a few complaints regarding the toilets and I did have a little trouble with my toilet. I think their toilets are designed to save on water and sometimes those type of toilets don't flush as well. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. I think a person would be hard-pressed to find a better hotel at this price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Co_MeathMairead
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 night stay in The Hampton Inn. We were sorry to leave and would love to return. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was fantastic. It was our first visit to Orlando and we were within walking distance of several lovely restaurants. We did not rent a car but used the taxi service attached to the hotel to get around. This was cheaper than renting a car. The driver - Jean Brice, was a real gentleman. Breakfast was a treat. The children looked forward to the complimentary cookies at 6 o clock. The pool was clean and never busy. An endless supply of fluffy white towels was supplied to swimmers. All staff members were friendly and helpful. We really miss the lovely coffee which was available all day long. Free Internet access made it easy to check emails. For the price we paid for our stay I had 2 star expectations but for the time I stayed in the Hampton I felt like a 5 star customer!

Reviews.Title: “What A Steal Deal”
Reviews.Author: GQ_Trippin
Reviews.Content: (We actually stayed in March 2005) HOTEL. Itâ€™s not easy finding an affordable hotel near the Theme Parks but this is a great hotel that offers shuttle bus rides to and from Disneyworld. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and delicious. We looked forward every morning for the fantastic breakfast. STAFF. Accommodating and pleasant. ROOM. Decent size and clean. LOCATION. Near the Convention Center. ATTRACTION. Attractions are all a shuttle bus ride away. TIP(S). There is a Sonic Burger nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TheladyLisa
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, excellent location, extremely friendly staff - you won't get a better deal in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT - Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: URCHER
Reviews.Content: This hotel could been the best investment of my money that I have made in a long time. The amenities were excellent; the pool was quiet, clean and the hotel supplied pool towels. The rooms were spacious, clean and more than ample, even with two adults and one small child. They were serviced daily and to a very high standard. The hotel offered to provide complimentary toiletries if you had forgotten them (i.e. razor, toothbrush etc). There was a gym (although I didnlt use it) and a small shop (this was expensive though). The complimentary breakfast was more than we expected and we saved a fortune by eating at the hotel before leaving for the day. The staff were beyond friendly, with one lady buying our son toys, baking fresh cookies just for us and giving him bottles of juice to take to the parks. There was fresh coffee available all day in reception and after a hard day at Disney it was nice to have this facility - again another ideal way to save money. The hotel itself is more aimed at adult holiday makers and even though we had ordered a cot they were unable to provide one. They recitified this by making a small bed on the floor for our 2 year old and it was great how they did this. It made him feel very special. The room was big enough for our needs on the holiday as we found that the rooms were only used for a base. The hotel is not in I-Drive but it's location is better because it is close enough to the hustle and bustle of I-Drive (several mini-golf courses as well as restaurants, pubs and shops). It was a short walk through a carpark and it took you straight onto I-Drive between some wonderful restaurants. The hotel was quieter because it was slightly removed from the noise in the evenings, not to mention to traffic. We were thrilled with every aspect of the hotel and would recommend it to anybody. I recognise that parents with more than 1 young child may experience difficulies though.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lmw10
Reviews.Content: This really was a great value hotel - Â£45 a night! The rooms were big and had all amenities you would expect. Breakfast was fantastic also, with a very good selection of foods e.g. fruits, yogurts, muffins, danish pastry, and a change in hot foods each day. Coffee and tea was also available all day. Was within easy access to all the attractions, maybe about 20 mins to Disney and about 10 mins up to Universal. Another big plus was the Pointe Orlando shopping mall and restaurants area and International Drive which are in easy walking distance. In my optinion, really top value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Usual Hampton- High standards”
Reviews.Author: Travellingirl58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and found everything to be of the usual high standards we come to expect from Hampton Inns. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. And the beds and pillows, they are so comfortable. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice and was replenished quickly as required. Staff were very helpful and polite, always spoke to you whenever you passed them. The pool was closed for a day or so while we were there but there were notices in lifts etc informing you of this. A great location with easy access to I Drive, shops, restaurants etc. Would certainly stay here again if visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Mallogal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Hampton Inn and would definitely recommend it. The location is great - although the address is Universal Boulevard, if you go out of the back entrance you are on International Drive within a few minutes. The rooms are large and the beds are great! The only slight downside to the room is that the aircon is on the noisy side. The breakfast is ample and as a lot of people going to conferences use the hotel, breakfast wasn't busy at all after 8.30am. Similarly we could always get a spot by the pool although, due to the extremely wet weather whilst we were there, we didn't lay out much! I have stayed in a number of hotels in the I Drive area and this would definitely rate within my top 2. Oh, and they also serve complimentary freshly baked cookies on some evenings!

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: Bubbavon
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 8 days on a business trip. I paid $99 US a night. Friends stayed at the Rosen Centre or our convetione and paid $199 a night. Here is a list of things I got and they didn't Free parking Fridge Microwave Free internet Great free breakfast Free snacks and 24 gour coffee and tea Coffee in the room Dailey paper. Friendly staff. Quiet all the time Bigger rooms I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: biggazz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks last year, Very clean very comfortable with a decent breakfast. Staff where great and overall no issues Gaz

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pughies
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel to use as a base for visiting the parks. It was an excellent choice. The location is ideal, located on Universal Blvd but just a short walk through car park at rear of hotel & you're on I Drive. It's a quiet location but you're within easy walking distance of I Drive. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean and the staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast is included in the price and was good, free tea & coffee is available all day. The pool area is a really nice place to unwind after a long day at the parks & pool towels are available. There's a computer in reception for guest use with free internet access, handy for checking out the different parks before visiting. There's plenty of free parking. If you're visiting the area be sure to eat at the Bahama Breeze (at end of car park behind hotel on I Drive) Expect to wait in excess of an hour for a table but the food is well worth the wait. We will definately use this hotel when visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all- rounder, away from the I-Drive crowds”
Reviews.Author: thecoaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in March 09 after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Booked through Travel Jungle. Part of 2 week holiday to Orlando. Good points: Good all- rounder. At the quieter end of I-Drive. Lots of restaurants/ bars nearby but not as hectic/ busy as the northern end of I- Drive. Easy access to Universal Boulevard- easy to go straight up to Universal without going on I-Drive. Half way between Seaworld and Universal. Nice pool. Nice guests- tend to be business people visiting the nearby convention centre, not packed with families with screaming kids !! Negative points: Only 1, the air conditioning units are separate units in the rooms, as mentioned elsewhere on trip advisor reviews, ie not centrally ducted and are noisy in the rooms. We switched ours off when went to bed so dont let that put you off staying here unless you need it on all night and are a light sleeper. Hints: Cookies are available on reception from around 4- 530pm. There is a PC with free internet access and printer in the breakfast area available all day. Would I advise staying there: Yes. Looked for ages on Trip Advisor to find a hotel as many in i-Drive area. If you want a small- mid sized hotel thats got a pool and away from the busy end of I-Drive/ with quieter clientel then pick here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterWaves
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights, it was great value and in an excellent location. We had looked at the Homewood Suites but opted for this, and we're so glad we did, it turned out to be right next door and it was a nice hotel! The location was perfect, walk through the parking lot and you are on I drive near all the bars and restaurants. We would highly recommend the Bahama Breeze, it serves great food, great cocktails and has a great atmosphere. The only issue we had was when we enquired at reception about how to get to disney without a car, the receptionist looked as if no one has ever asked her that before and was fairly unhelpful. We ended up going to the visitor centre who told us about the lynx bus, its very easy despite what the receptionist said. Apart from that everything was great, the rooms were clean and spacious and we would definitely stay there again and we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: g-welshy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 08, great loacation - only five minutes away from International Drive but away from all the bustle. Just 2 minutes from Pointe Orlando Centre which has lots of nice restaurants and shops. Easy to get to all of the parks including Seaworld and not to far away from Disney either. Room was very spacious with lovely comfortable beds! Comfiest beds i have ever experienced!! and we also got a pool view which was handy. Pool was usually quiet and is quite small but nice enough. No bar at hotel which may not suit everyone but we had no problem as bars and restaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel. Also a small gym which was handy. Only downside was that the room had no fridge but didn't prove to be much of a problem. Staff were so helpful and always acknowledged us. Brilliant breakfast with so much choice - something to suit everyone! and the hotel also had lovely touches like free USA Today newspaper delivered to your door every morning, free hot chocolate, tea and coffee all day and free home-made cookies and lemonde early evening in the reception area. Internet was also free. Overall excellent hotel which i would definately go back to!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PJ_Diddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for 2 weeks at the start of Aug 2008 after our travel agent bumped us from our original accommodation. We were offered another hotel up I-Drive but turned it down and were offered this one whose location appealed to us much more and thus avoiding the tourist traffic I-Drive brings so we picked it not knowing what it was like. After checking here we were pleasantly surprised at its rating and having returned from our hols can confirm we had a delightful stay there. Its not the Ritz or Savoy but its more than adequate for a couple of weeks visiting the parks especially for the money. We found it's location perfect, near Universal and Seaworld, not too far from Disney and provided there were no big conventions at the centre (happened just once while we were there and getting past was a bit of a nightmare) then there was no traffic until you reached the I-4. Our original hotel did offer a fridge but only some rooms here have them, we did request one with the travel agent but the request wasn't passed on and our room didn't have one (it was a decent sized room and didn't look bad btw if you do get one). Unusually for us we returned to reception and asked if we could have another room, they weren't sure if they could accommodate us but the manager had a look and did find us a room and switched us without any extra charge. It was a bigger room overlooking the pool with a nice bright bathroom and big mirror as well as a decent size fridge and a microwave. The bathroom also had a small coffee maker with tea bags and coffee inserts but we found taking a couple of hot choc sachets from downstairs handy! There was also a hairdryer and iron. USA Today was delivered to your room Mon-Fri and maid service was fine. If you manage to get a room overlooking the pool then you have an added bonus of being able to see the Seaworld fireworks in the distance every night! Breakfast ran from 6am til 10am and for once there were enough chairs and tables to go round no matter what time we got there! There was always plenty available even if you came down later on and for days when you just want to get going they had bags with water, muffin, cereal bar and an apple ready to go on reception. Staff were friendly and always said hello. Breakfast selection was plentiful but a bit more of a variety wouldn't have gone amiss with the hot food. There are two hot items on offer but one was almost always an egg and usually sausage or sometimes ham. There was always bread (and toaster), biscuits, muffins, danish, bagels, cereal and fruit but it we missed the waffle maker we had in a previous hotel (although it was a hot item one day). In addition there was coffee (regular and decaf), tea, water, fruit juice and milk. If you found yourself in the hotel in the afternoon then cookies could sometimes be found on the front desk. The hot drinks were available for free in the breakfast area all day but sometimes did run out (they keep extra stock in the cupboard underneath if you're desperate!). We didn't use the pool or gym so can't comment. Overall it was the best hotel we've stayed in for an Orlando holiday and doubt we would go to another provided we had a room with fridge although if you are only staying a few days then this probably wouldn't bother you. I heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above average staff friendliness. Below average cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: Plentyodough
Reviews.Content: This was such a highly rated TripAdvior choice we had to try it for a business trip. THE GOOD: The fastest check-in I think we have ever experienced in our life. Super friendly staff. Good central location in a safe neighborhood. Hot breakfast was average. Egg & cheese omlet one day, hot (kinda just warm borderline cold) waffles and keilbasa the next. Breakfast buffet immaculate and well stocked and manned. THE BAD AND THE UGLY: Bathroom cleanliness was not acceptable. The toilet seat was raised upon arrival. (Bad sign.) When I put the seat down, it had small,brown smears on it. Sink countertop had dried water drips on it that smeared off. YUCK!!!! Normally would have complained or changed rooms. But due to a hurried schedule, had to rush out to an appointment. So just decided to buy disinfecting wipes at the local grocery store, only a short drive away. Figured doing it myself would ensure a clean bathroom. (Switching rooms wouldn't necessarily be cleaner....maybe just appear that way.) The short of it. We got a dirty bathroom. Surely all of the bathrooms in this hotel could not be as bad as what we got. But traveler beware....bring some Chlorox wipes just to be sure! 2nd floor a bit noisy - you can hear every car coming and going. Opt for higher floor. Walls between rooms thin. It sounded like a jet engine everytime a neighbor took a shower. (And I imagine our showers also gave them the runway take-off environment.) Internet was down. Room did not have a refridgerator, which we thought was standard. We called 800#, they told us we could request one for free. When spoke w/management, they said we could "upgrade" for $20 more to a room w/a fridge. Hummmmm.....No thanks. Not the worst place we've been at, but definately disappointed overall. Did not leave feeling too refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: cocolinu
Reviews.Content: Great choice hotel,very clean,very comfortable, with good breakfast, close to pretty much everything, no hidden fees, very well kept, and with a great pool,that we couldn't get enough of. I might say that it is the pool that made our trip. Staff was efficient and pleasant. We experienced 2 issues: *the movie channel,that one is supposed to order movies from, did not work until 2 days before checkout, they did however go out of their way to fix it, and did so in the end *the king suite did not have either fridge or microwave, and they were an additional 20$/ night. However, as a consequence of us not being able to use their system to order movies, we received the fridge (did not need the microwave) at no extra charge for the remaining of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Air Con By Harley Davidson”
Reviews.Author: zoomer300
Reviews.Content: I too cannot understand the high rating. The hotel is adequate but looking a little tired, not up to the usual Hampton Inn standards. Staff were helpful and efficient. My problem is with the noise generated by the window air con unit. Usually when confronted with one of these monstrosities I put it on full cool before going out to eat then turn it off on return hoping room will stay comfortable over night. This time I forgot. The noise coming from this thing would put a Hog to shame..... (Hampton Inns seem to have cornered the market in crap AC units)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: Pentwater--summerjoy
Reviews.Content: Am still wondering how this hotel earned such a high rating here on Trip Advisor; it's the first time I've ever been let down here. Yes, the place was OK for one night in Orlando, but number two among all other choices? Positives: reasonable rates; above average continental breakfast; reasonably comfortable beds. Negatives: surly, unhelpful night manager; frayed around the edges and in need of a facelift; very average rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: SeattleIndividual
Reviews.Content: Business stay requiring proximity to the Convention Center. This hotel is within reasonable walking distance. The hotel was in good condition. No complaints at all. Not a long walk over to many restaurants on International Drive and walking at night in October is quite pleasant. I would stay here again if I have business at the Convention Center. It was interesting to see that the hotel is very popular with European and Aussie families.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: kimmie375
Reviews.Content: i needed a place to stay for one night on my trip and came across a great price online.after reading the reviews I booked it. Upon arrival everyone was nice and informative.We recieved our room immediatly.Even though it was not on the first floor as i requested. When we arrived in our roon my first thought was "omg these beds are small!" I was told 2 queen size and they were full/double. Every thing was clean and in order. We were informed the pool was open till 12am but when we came back at 10:15pm the pool was closed and we were told the pool was closed to to low occupency.So we went to our room. I had to then exchance my remote 3x's and they still didnt work,the volume wouldnt turn down on the tv. In the morning we found the alarm clock didnt work.good thing we didnt have some where to be. The breakfast was less than tasty.My daughter is a vegatierian and the eggs contained bacon,everything else was bread.all the fruit and yougart was gone by 9am. If I caught the deal again I might stay but I'd never pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpion3698
Reviews.Content: This is a superb value hotel. I mainly booked it because of the trip advisor reviews and I'm glad to say I wasn't disappointed. The staff are very friendly and are only too willing to help. The location is superb. If you simply walk out of the front door and double back on yourself then you are on I-Drive within a couple of minutes where there are a number of nice eateries within a couple of minutes walk. I agree it seems more like a business hotel but it suited us and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SwedenGolfer
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet area, conveniently located close to I-4 without having trouble with any noise from it. The room was large with two double beds and spotless clean. Breakfast with enough selection of bread, cereals and fruits. The staff was very friendly and helpful, I had a problem with the toilet the first day and it was solved within 30 minutes, IÂ´m very satisfied with my stay and will definitely stay here again next time in Orlando, have been at several other hotels at earlier vacations and none of them even close to Hampton Inn regarding price-comfort. Also found the free internet (with a printer) as a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: YuleeJacksonville
Reviews.Content: Easy access to I-4 and located on quiet street. Very clean. Due to cool weather couldn't use the pool; a hot tub would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - again!!”
Reviews.Author: enidminko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week (8th to 15th November) - had a brilliant time again (stayed last May too). Checked in easily - straight to room. Fabulous big room, with a HUGE bed - all very clean & tidy. In a quiet location on the ground floor - perfect. Was very quiet there - not many people about at all, mostly business people using the hotel for the Convention Center. Helpful, friendly staff- free breakfast a bonus, always something hot to have & a great choice of pastries, muffins bagels etc. Just out the back parking lot is I Drive - so a great location away from the "Blackpool" end (no offence to Blackpool of course!). Saw the shuttle launch whilst there (amazing) and also renewed our wedding vows- so all in all a great holiday. Parks were empty - nd when i say empty - i mean empty. We did not queue ONCE for any of the rides - brilliant! Overall the best hotel i have used in Orlando - definitely recommend it & would definitely return there. Thanks Hampton Inn!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanfordBarnsley
Reviews.Content: Visited in sept and had 5 nights then went to the keys for 4 nights and then spent another 5 nights here. Rooms very clean and plenty of towels in bathroom Staff from the manager to the cleaners are second to none. Breakfast is what we wanted,because lets be honest the american buffet can be a bit too much. There were all different breads, juices buns and pastries. Pool was good, I agree that the hotel could do with a bar but thats life i suppose All in all a excellent place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: YorkHolGirl
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was very good. The staff are very friendly and are happy to help with any questions you may have. I came with one of my mates and we had 2 double beds in our room which i found to be very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and spacious with fresh towels everyday. The shower was nice and powerful. Pool was nice and quiet, we never had a problem getting a sun lounger. Breakfast was nice although i never had any of the cooked stuff as i'm vegetarian so it didn't appeal to me. But there was aways plenty of bread available for toast. They also did muffins, bagels and sweet pastries. Hotel was only a short walk to I Drive. The only thing i didn't like about this hotel was that there were no free shuttles to various parks even though our folder in our room stated they did. They did offer a paying shuttle, which weren't all that cheap. We tended to use the I Ride. The hotel could also of done with having a restaurant and a bar. But on the whole a very good hotel and i would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: claire12345
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, i thought this hotel was good value. However, do not expect 5* service. This is a 2/3* hotel which has some lovely extras such as free coffee all day, free freshly baked cookies etc in the lobby. The rooms are tastefully decorated and quite spacious. The beds are extremely comfortable! Compared to other hotels in the price range, it is far better value for money. The brekfast was plentiful, however the hot food always looked a bit weird so we never tried it. But unlike most hotels, if you went down for breakfast a few mins late, there was always something there you could grab. They also have on the go bags which have a breakfast bar, apple, muffin and bottle of water in them for when u are heading out in a hurry. The pool area was lovely but there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel which was a let down. The hotel also has its drawbacks. Sometimes the lift broke, sometimes the front door didnt open, our toilet overflowed and flooded the bathroom! The room was near the lifts and was very noisy from about 7am. The walls seemed to be very thin and we could hear the pipes creaking. The hotel does not offer free shuttles to any of the parks. They do offer a shuttle at a price.... a round trip ticket to disney is 16 dollars each, which is not cheap. The hotel is not ideally situated, but it is about 200yards from I Drive. It is near some lovely restaurants- try Bahama Breeze, Ming Court and Cafe Tu Tu Tango. For a relaxing holiday in Orlando, i would recommend the Hampton Inn, but dont expect excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Einsfo
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife, my nephew and my niece stayed at the Hampton Inn from August 21-30, 2008 and had an excellent stay. The hotel isn't actually fancy, but everything is very well maintained and clean. The staff is more than friendly (they were all great!) and is always thinking of a treat to their guests: everyday, when returning from shopping of from the parks, we found warm cookies or brownies being served in the lobby. Location is good, close to I-drive and its restaurants. If you are going to theme parks, it won't take more than 15-20 minutes to reach any of them. Malls and outlets are also within a short drive. Breakfast is included and although there are rather limited options, it worked out perfectly for us. The only downside for us was the size of the beds. They are very comfortable but really, really narrow. I even thought they were single beds when we arrived... Overall, the hotel exceeded â€“ by far â€“ our expectations, especially at such a low price (US$60/day), and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, great value.”
Reviews.Author: DutchJerry
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hampton Inn last august (2008). I must say that the beds are very comfortable and one of the better ones I've experienced. Friendly service, the staff was very helpful in supplying information. The cleanliness of the room was very good, housekeeping does an excellent job. Location is nice: close to the international drive. Restaurants can be reached on foot, as well as a small shopping center (Pointe Orlando). Breakfast that was included is sufficient although nothing spectacular. (Toast/cereal/2 choices of hot food, fruit and some snacks) Free WIFI with decent speed. A positive experience and I will surely check availability next time I'm in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in orlando”
Reviews.Author: loracdanenyaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, friendly staff, good pool, and the best beds ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarlequinKirkcaldy
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from hoilday in Orlando.The Hampton Inn certainly deserves the great reviews it consistently receives. Good buffet breakfast,friendly helpful staff and in a perfect location for an Orlando holiday.I did not hire a car but Lynx bus stops and I - ride trolley stops were all a short walking distance away on International Drive.I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for a great price”
Reviews.Author: DrViajante
Reviews.Content: I went to a congress in the Convention Center, that is very close from the hotel, the hotel is very close to a Mall., too.The rooms are very good and cozy. The staff have a small number of people, but they are very frindly and efficient. The breakfast is free and rezonable, I would like more cheese. Overall it is a fantastic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mydmonk
Reviews.Content: I read through trip advisor before booking a hotel. The reviews for this hotel were right on. The room for us was a little small with two adults and three children. But for a smaller family it would be just fine. The hotel staff were more than accomidating. They were more than happy to help anyone with anything to make sure they enjoyed their stay. The breakfast was really good. Having the coffee and hot chocolate (the kids loved that) available 24 hrs a day was great. The kids loved the pool and there really wasn't more than 6 people in the pool at one time and 3 of them were mine.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Rocked”
Reviews.Author: SabanNation
Reviews.Content: Great room!!! At $38 through priceline it was a steal!!!((taxes and fees included) Friendly staff but they do have an attitude to "Priceline Guests"

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near International Drive”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0999
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 children, needed a place to stay for one night near Disney. We booked this thru TravelZoo.com. A nice hotel near International Drive. Quiet. Pool was good. Staff was friendly. Beware of the cost of transportation to Disney and less frequency.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rclaire_cullen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 12 days for our anniversary. We were very pleased with everything about the hotel from the plentiful breakfast to the generous sized rooms and beds. The staff were always pleasant and on hand to assist with anything. On check-in we were given a twin room, even though we had requested a double room before hand, but the staff were very accommodating into moving us to a room more suited. The location was very good - we had a car for the holiday but if not then there was transport for the parks and international drive is only a 5 minute walk away. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and we would recommend TGI's, Tony Romas and Ming Court, especially if you want a change from the fast food option! We stayed at the Springhill Suites last year, which is next door, and between the two we would choose the Hampton Inn if we are to return.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was great”
Reviews.Author: MJefferson65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August, the weather was extremely hot and humid. The rooms were cool, staff was great, knowlegeable and willing to help. Swimming pool rarely got overcrowded and every where in the hotel was clean and tidy. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “above average establisment”
Reviews.Author: scubastrong
Reviews.Content: Do not expect a warm welcome here when you have booked through a cheaper booking agent rather than booking through hotel!!!!booked through( www.travelrepublic.co.uk )The welcome was very warm even gave us a room on the topfloor until he checked reservation and realised it was pre-paid via travel republic when he came up with some excuse of the rooms on the 7th floor were very hot(even though they have air conditioning!!!!)he tried to change it to a room that was next to the gym and on the rabbit run to reception!!!i rejected this and he then put us on the 4th floor.We were not told of hotel renervations upon check in and neither told about the free drinks or cookies after 5pm in the lobby!!!The rooms were above average and extremley clean and the hotel in a great location for a 10 min stroll onto international drive where there is an abundance of restaraunts.pool area clean and quiet and at the rate of Â£37.50/$73.00inc of tax a night for 4 people with an average breakfast i would recomend this hotel and would use it again myself.they just need to work on there manners a little for guests that enjoy a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location!”
Reviews.Author: pinzonero
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the hotel and all I can tell is how satisfied I was with my stay. Breakfast, rooms, front desk, amenities, pool were very convenient. The hotel has the perfect location. Thanks to the manager, Adriana for all her attention and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: GailLakeland
Reviews.Content: I stayed over 3 nites, my husband was gone all day in business conference, i was happy we picked this hotel, beds were comfortable, free breakfast was great everyday. close to international dr, I drove but could of walked down there. We were pleased. We paid 89.00 +tx each night aaa rate. WE WILL BE BACK. April is definately best time to go,nice not to hot, less crowds. Nice heated pool.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed”
Reviews.Author: LakeDistrictEngland
Reviews.Content: We loved the one night we stayed here with our 10 year old son. The pool was lovely and warm - some might think too warm though? The breakfast was great , as indeed was the whole experience. We asked for a quiet room and had a peaceful night. 10/10 as far as we were concerned.

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Lainey17
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at this hotel largely based on the reviews here at Trip Advisor. We were very disappointed. It was trouble right from checking in. We had booked a non-smoking room and when we entered our room it reeked of smoke. We immediately returned to the front desk and requested to move. The front desk attendant turned to one of the housekeepers and rudely exclaimed - they say (room #) smells of smoke (the tone obviously implied that we were lying or crazy) . Then my friend and I both got stuck in the elevator for at least 10 minutes (2 separate times). But the worst part was that they had decided to have all the rooms carpets steam-cleaned on the second day of our stay. We were informed of this by a letter being pushed under our door - basically saying we needed to be out of our rooms all day. When I inquired if we would be getting a discount on our rooms as we had paid for access to them all day we were tired and wanted to just lounge around) the girl at the desk replied absolutely not - no discount. The letter did say if you had a problem with the steamcleaning to make them aware of that - which we did (along with at least 10 other guests I heard complaining at the same time).I also asked if they would be safeguarding all of our effects as we didn't want to have to move things our into our car. The front desk agent said - "Well someone from housekeeping should be in there. This did not reassure me as it did not sound convincing or reliable. Additonally, We had asked for a quiet room - no such luck - we had kids running and yelling in the hallway for a good part of the first night. We also found out that the free shuttle (advertised when we booked) to Universal was not free at all but $9.00 per person each way and donly ran a few times a day.Then the next morning I asked for a tea bag at breakfast - they had none. ( I don't think that was out of line. We had just come from a marvellous stay at the Hampton in West Palm Beach and were expecting something along the same lines. Instead we found this Hampton hotel to be a little worn and shabby, front desk staff condescending and not very helpful, and overcrowded. The only good thing was that they did honour the Hampton satisfaction guarantee and refund our first night due to all the problems. We moved 2 doors down to the Amerisuites which was being changed over to the Hyatt Park Place and what a difference - it was amazing and more of what we expected of the Hampton. I would never recommend this Hampton Hotel. Maybe we caught them at a bad time - judging from the other reviews - but I felt like we were not even at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, really!!”
Reviews.Author: MN_Tokyo
Reviews.Content: After reading the rave reviews, I checked again to be sure that I booked the very same hotel. First my room key did not work because the batteries needed replacing. They didn't have enough front desk staff to come with me to investigate the problem so I made two trips back and forth before maintenance was called. The maintenance person was friendly, cheerful and efficient and I appreciated that. After that, the light bulb on the desk burned out the first time I turned on the lamp, and then the lamp didn't work at all with a bulb from another place - I said to myself, I must be having a bit of bad luck, but no, I think they just don't have a regular maintenance check of items in the room. The floors were always sticky in the elevator and breakfast area, and weren't mopped once during my 2-day stay. The breakfast trays were also sticky. The wireless Internet access is not secure - you need to disable WEP and other forms of encryption - which might be a problem for some companies. They best part of this hotel was the 24-hour coffee service and brownies and cookies in the evening - Ah, the culprit for all the stickiness. There is drink and food but almost no clean-up service - not a place for a gal like me but perhaps the guys staying there didn't seem to mind - or did they? The rooms are large an clean and the hot water was always flowing with ample pressure. These are the reasons for the good ratings here perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly staff, felt like home and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jc58Uk
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this this hotel apr 2006 , loved it so much i went back again the following year!!. the hotel is very clean and well presented and the staff are exceptional and friendly not afraid to talk to you unlike in some places!, rooms are cleaned to a high standard and all the toiletteries in the bathroom were fully stocked every day, which was a good thing as we forgot to bring simple things like soap and showergel.staff on reception are brilliant and have good knowledge of the local area/ amenities. and there is also a lovely continental breakfast everyday serving hot and cold self service food, which was free of charge!! also there complimentary hot teas and coffee in the foyer all day long. the hotel is in a good location on international drive, right near the convention centre (hence the name), can be a bit of a nitemare if you arrive when there is a convention on as the traffic around the area can be horrific as we found out on our arrival. next door to the hotel is pointe orlando, which has just been re=opened after a facelift, plenty of small shops and bars within. also located around this area is family friendly restaurants like th ponderosa, which like everywhere in america is all you can eat!!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: sarah119
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night stay at the Hampton Inn. I booked it on bookinhotels for 53 euro a night, which was great value. The rooms had two double beds very clean and bright , we requested a quiet room because we had two young kids and it was the quietest hotel room that I have ever stayed in. The only thing missing was a fridge and a microwave. Breakfast was from 6am and was great more than enough,and free coffee throughout the day. The pool was another pleasent surprise it was so warm the kids loved it and we nearly always had it to ourselves. I highly reccomend the hampton the location couldn't have been better and the staff were always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “more for your money”
Reviews.Author: theoldcottage
Reviews.Content: The holiday was a 60th birthday present from my daughter who took theholiday with me, never being to Orlando before it was a bit nerve racking finding our way from Sanford Airport, eventually we found the hotel and even though it was late at night the staff could not do enough for us.
