We found all the staff helpful, and finding I had not brought toothpaste and brush they were given to us free of charge from the reception. The rooms were very large with colour tv and the bathrooms were equiped with shampoo, conditioner and bath bubbles every day. There is a free breakfast every morining and as much tea and coffee you could drink. At the end of every floor there is a drinks machine and plenty of ice to keep you drinks cold. The swimming pool was never fully used and there was always plenty of room and nice clean towels to keep you dry. Through the car park and you were on International drive with the Point Orlando Shopping centre on your doorstep and plenty of places to eat, we were also near to the I stops where for 2 Dollar you could go from one end of the drive to another great if you have not got a car, for 16 dollars about 8 pounds you can by a ticket for fourteen days to use the I trollyey a good investment. All in all a great holiday for a inexpensive price, I would recomend this hotel to anyone who has got a budget, you get such a lot for your money, the only downside was when we had to go home.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: evertonians
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights from 25th dec [ two rooms - celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary]. we were delighted with our choice [we always checkout trip advisor]. we paid Â£25 per room per night, and that included a very ample breakfast - the "robust" coffee gave us a kick-start!! the staff were all excellent, and went out of their way to help! although the hotel was full, the rooms were quiet and very clean. ideal position - much quieter than i-drive.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: joanne_sear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Orlando more times than we can count and have stayed at quite a few hotels. The Hampton Inn Convention Center is by far the best. For the money that you pay you couldn't ask for any more. The service is excellent (we were warmly welcomed at 3am after a 12 hour flight delay), the rooms large and tastefully decorated and the location fantastic. The fact that you get a free breakfast (though mostly pastries) is great for Orlando and the coffee machines (on the ground and 4th floors) are very well received (especially when your travel kettle doesn't even have enough power to melt ice). Within stumbling distance are Bahama Breeze (the yummiest restaurant I have ever been to), TGIs, Olive Garden, Dennys and Walgreens which is really handy for small groceries. The pool is smallish but usually almost empty. We stayed at the height of summer and never had a problem getting sunbeds. All in all I can't recommend this hotel enough - and I lead by example - we've already booked to stay again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “The service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: NaturalLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The overall experience was great and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel terrible breakfast experience -Dec 25, 2007”
Reviews.Author: worldair
Reviews.Content: We went to breakfast at 9:00 and there was no breakfast left. The front desk told me that twe needed to go to breakfast earlier if we expected to get something. Noone offered to find anything. The Dennys was good. The room was nice and comfortable. I will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraftyCol_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Convention Center for two weeks as part of a package holiday. It is an excellent hotel which is maintained to a high standard and spotlessly clean. The free breakfast was really good and replenished repeatedly during the morning by the attentive staff. The hotel is in a great location just off I-Drive yet near enough to all of the restaurants and attractions. We would have no hesitation in staying at the Hampton Inn if we were lucky enough to visit Orlando again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, best value for my money I ever get at a hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: RalfBeier
Reviews.Content: That was a perfect stay. The rooms are large and very clean. The staff extremely friendly and the brekfast great. The first night we stayed at a room two rooms to the elevator. When the elevators were busy you could hear the sound of it so we couldn't sleep from 6 am on. The front desk changed our room immediately and we were fully satisfied the second night. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moriaHilversum
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews about this hotel,booked this hotel,and no regrets,stayed here for 1 week,the girls at the desk were always very friendly,and helpful,free good breakfast, free internet, enough parking,good beds,and maybe more important a good price.Good situated and several restaurants in the neigbourhood.Can't understand bad reviews(Stayed after this in Miami, no breakfast, parking $8.- a day,more expensive, and less friendly).

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Okie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the end of November, and paid just Â£28 a night. Let's be clear up front, this place is definitely a budget choice without many 'frills'. The reason I've given 5 stars is because for the money this place can't be beat! The location of the hotel was perfect...just off I-drive so very quiet, yet within 2-3 minute walk of Bahama Breeze, TGIs, Cafe Tu Tu Tango and loads of other restaurants on I-drive...also 5 minute drive from Universal studios and Seaworld and maybe 10-15 from Disneyworld. And if you want to shop, it's a short drive to two great malls, the Florida Mall and the Mall at Millenia. The room we had was spacious, had a really comfortable bed, and was spotlessly clean...it was near the ice machine which was quite noisy when in use, but never disturbed us at night. The maid service was fantastic, keeping the room spotless all week. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, saying hi whenever we walked past the desk and giving great advice on local restaurants, entertainment etc. when asked. The hotel also has a small gym on the ground floor (which we didn't use), and an outdoor pool that was very clean and bigger than it looked on the website. The rate includes a buffet breakfast which is fairly basic, but has bread/toast, bagles, muffins, pastries, yogurts, fruit salad (mix of grapefruit and orange), as well as fruit juice, tea and coffee (coffee and tea available on every floor, 24/7 - coffee was drinkable but not fantastic, but then again it was free). There is also a hot item offered (rotates daily...on different days we saw french toast, waffles, eggs and bacon, breakfast sausage etc) but this never looked that appetising and we skipped it. When we fancied a full hot breakfast, we drove up the road to First Watch on Sand Lake Rd, which does great breakfast...Â£28 a night left us some spare change! Overall, this was a great budget choice, and we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Wrinklymiller
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th visit to Orlando and probably the one I enjoyed most. The Hampton was everything I needed: Immaculately clean, bright room, great service, free internet, ample breakfast and a fantastic, convenient location. If I fancy a 7th visit I will look no further than the Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service at this Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMC_7
Reviews.Content: It's not often that 5 minutes after you arrive in your room Reception rings to ask you if you room is up to your expectations. Needless to say it was!! That sort of service was typical of the whole stay. The rooms are great and of a good size, the bed was fantastic and you get a free breakfast! Staff are very helpful and pleasant. This is a wonderful hotel in the heart of International Drive convenient for the all the action that Orlando has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Dundalkontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hampton Inn Convention Center for 19 nights in September and I cannot rate it highly enough. Have been to Orlando a number of times & have stayed in a few the budget type hotels (IMHO you spend so little time in your room in Orlando splashing out on an expensive hotel would be a waste of money), e.g Quality Inns International & Plaza, Best Western Plaza etc, and although I had no major issues with these, the one thing that always drove me mad were the cheap flowery bedspreads. So when I arrived at the Hampton Inn to be greeted by Crisp White Bed linens I was already in love. Bed linen aside, I found the room very comfortable & extremely quiet (one tip I will give though is to make sure you get a room away from the Ice Machines as they appear to be very noisy). The hotel was full while we were there but yet it never appeared crowded eg... every evening we went for a swim in the pool & it was like having our own private swimming pool.... even during the day it was never busy. Breakfast was a bonus as normally in the past we've had to pay for it. The location was excellent... just off International drive (2 min walk) & perfect for some of my favourite restaurants like Olive Garden & Bahama Breeze. Just some other Tips... although the Hampton Inn doesn't offer free shuttles to Universal & Seaworld like some other hotels..... the secret is that the hotels themselves don't actually provide these free shuttles but the flex tickets do.... so just find the nearest hotel with a free shuttle, ask them for the pick-up timetable (don't tell them that you are from another hotel) & just go there in the mornings. And finally.... the I Ride.... although it is a novelty at first.... I find it very time consuming & tedious after a while. In actual fact the Lynx buses travel the same routes & you get to your destination a lot quicker & alot less crowded (If you go to the Lynx website you can print off a timetable & they are normally very punctual). One particular issue that I have is that alot of guide books etc tell you that when going to Disney to get the I-Ride to Sea Harbour Drive & then from there get the Lynx 50 to Disney, when in actual fact you can get the Lynx 8 from International Drive & with that ticket you get a free transfer to the Lynx 50 (so instead of paying the I ride fare & the Lynx fare all you have to pay is the one lynx fare). Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nico85
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 2 weeks in September and we booked through travel republic. We paid around Â£12 a night each!! And that was including breakfast. For the price, the hotel was fantastic, we had a double bed each, large bathroom, large tv with loads of movies on and even a games console! The hotel is spotless and your room is cleaned every day, although i did notice that your sheets are not changed everyday, the just make the bed. The breakfast has a good selection of food and if you dont have time reception makes up breakfast packs which you can take with you. There is a small gym in the hotel and the pool is lovely and hardly anyone uses it. The only downside to the hotel is that there is no bar, however there is a little shop and TGI'S offer room service. We tried this once but the food wasn't very nice but most of the food places near the hotel will deliver to your room. For example Dominos is great and so cheap! The location is great aswel, you just walk through the car park and you are on international drive. Try Tony Romas for the best ribs and Magianos Italian is lovely. They do a lunch special which is soup and a pasta for $10!!! Ponderosa is also great for breakfast, especially if u have a family, it costs around $4 for all you can eat and the food isnt that bad. The shuttles from the hotel can be quite expensive if you are using them everyday but you can get the i-ride to most places for a dollar. There is loads more that I could write as the hotel really is a little gem. You will notice when you drive through Florida that a lot of the hotels dont look that good and are more like motels and are more expensive than the Hampton. Overall a fantastic hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: squidly777
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Florida and this hotel made it perfect! we found a real bargain and only paid Â£250 for 8 nights for two of us in a twin room! My friend and I had a double bed each, which im assuming is standard in America. The journey to the hotel was an experience, but if you get there in the daylight just hop on the iride ~(green line) and it will stop sooooo close to it. the princess castle is nearby as are a few others so look out for them. the rooms were brilliant and they were clean and spacey. the beds were very comfy and felt like home! breakfast was always provided, and we took an on the run pack, a few days when we had early starts. the i-ride nearly opposite dropped you off at seaworld or you can go the opposite way and go to universal. we used the swimming pool once and it was warm and clean. hotel staff very nice! so glad i went there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Harpham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 16th Sept for 2 weeks for our honeymoon. The hotel was lovely and clean and smelt like fresh ground coffee most of the time. Our room was fabulous, quite basic but we had a view of the pool from our window. The bed was huge and soo comfortable, the air con worked a treat on those very hot days. The hotel was ideally situated, a 5 minute walk from international drive and far enough away to be nice and quiet and relaxing. Everyday we walked from the back of the hotel to international drive and caught the I-Ride trolley wherever we wanted to go. Closest food places to hotel were, TGI Fridays, Subway, Dominoes Pizza, The Olive Garden and Bahama Breeze. There is also a Walgreens 5 minutes away so that was quite handy. A 10 minute walk away would take you to even more food places and didn't seem like far away at all. Theres also 2 crazy golf courses 10 minutes in either direction. We were also near to pointe orlando, like a small shopping area and fancier restaurants (more expensive) also there is a big cinema here, which a good chill out day activity. The staff were very helpful when we needed them but didn't really need anything. Breakfast was great, muffins, bread for toast, bagels, cereal, yogurts, fresh fruit, buttermilk biscuits ( like scones ) and always two hot choices, usually a sausage burger and scrambled eggs, but sometimes waffles. The pool was lovely, its not the sort of hotel where there are lots of children so very quiet and peaceful, hardly anyone used it so we had it to ourselves most of the time. Overall a fantastic hotel to stay in and we got it for a great price which was even better. Definately thinking if we go to Orlando again we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 visits in September 0”
Reviews.Author: scousekeith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 occassions in Sept this year and the hotel was great staff very friendly,rooms clean and well furnished toiletries renewed every day as where the towels the A/C was not working properly but we got by. the buffet breakfast was fine but to be honest we only had the coffee and juice, the pool area was fine pool clean and fresh towels available This hotel is used for conventions mainly and forcruise transfers but it is quiet and just a few minutes walk from Bahm breeze and TGI we would stay there again try to get rooms 12-18 as you will not be disturbed by the elevator bell or the ice dispenser which are on every floo

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougie1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the best holiday ever. The hotel was spotless and is in a great location. The staff were always very friendly. Free tea and coffee/free internet connection/free breakfast/free pool towels all made the stay very special. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for possibly the best value for money hotel in Florida. The rooms are a good size and it is only a 2 minute walk on to International drive. Keep up the good work Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, good complimentary breakfast, cheap price”
Reviews.Author: TurnersTips
Reviews.Content: For $42 a night you can't complain really. Booked the pre-arrival rate through hotelopia which is just as well as the hotel quoted us $99 for a 1 night extension. Don't forget to search online for a 10% discount code for hotelopia! The room was a good size, clean and had comfortable beds (although the cheap comforters were really lumpy). Cable TV, tea/coffee maker, free in-room internet, and a selection of toiletries provided. The breakfast was decent - cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, yoghurts, juice and some other hot dishes that were indistinguishable to British guests. One good thing was the selection of coffee, flavoured creams and nice cookies available in reception from early evening. There was also a pool although we didn't use it. Free parking. One note, although most websites claim that there is a complimentary shuttle to the theme parks - it is NOT free - you pay $9 return each for a service that only runs once or twice a day, when a taxi costs $12 each way (ie. to Universal). But parking at the theme parks is the cheapest option at $12 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P'line
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. The room was very clean and well-equipped and the free buffet breakfast was very nice. The Hotel is in an area which is very close to International Drive and within minutes from SeaWorld. We would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: minnienix
Reviews.Content: Our party of 8 adults & 2 kids stayed at The Hampton Inn, Universal Blv, from Aug 29th - Sept 14th. Having been to Orlando for the past 4 years, and not been particularly impressed with previous hotels, we found The Hampton Inn wonderful. The whole hotel was immaculate, and it seemed to be cleaned from top to toe every day. All the staff we encountered were very friendly, helpful and proffessional. Our room (2 adults, 3yr old & a baby) was a good size, 2 queen size beds wich were sooo comfy and had gorgeous bed linen! It was nice to see up to date decor instead of the usual floral tat in most orlando hotels! Plenty of storage space, nice modern bathroom. (the hairdrier was rubbish though so best to take your own!) Everyday when we returned, the room was spotless with fresh towels and my daughters cuddly toys tucked into bed! The pool area is nice and it was never busy, it was like having our own private pool most of the time. Towels are also supplied for the pool. A choice of 2 hot breakfast items were available each day on a rotational basis. The ham & egg days were the best, but we were not too keen on the mushroom soup type stuff or the strange scrambled eggs! Each day there is also a good selection of fresh fruit, yoghurts, bagels, muffins, toast, pastries, cereals,fruit juice. Tea & Coffee is on tap all day in the foyer and on some of the floors. The only downside to this hotel is there is no bar or restaurant, but with I-drive just 2 mins away it wasn't a big problem. There is a direct room service line to TGI Friday's which we used one night & also Flippers does a great pizza delivery! All in all we had a great stay at The Hampton Inn and considering we only paid Â£410 for 15 nights (booked with ---) it really was worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “exactly whats needed”
Reviews.Author: englishtommy
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home after spending three weeks in the hampton inn. I must say that it was indeed a pleasure to stay there and would most certainly return. check-in was speedy and polite and we were in our room within 5 minutes of arriving. When we got into our room i noticed a dehumidifier and thought the room smelled musty. As i was looking around the room the phone rang and it waqs reception saying they had put us in the wrong room and would we mind returning to reception. We did this with no problem and whilst at reception i enquired wether a fridge was available and was told it was but was $10 per day so i passed on that one. we went to the new room and unpacked. somebody knocked the door and it was a porter with the fridge i said i didnt want it as it was $10 per day but they insisted we have it complimentary for the error in check-in (as we were here for 21 nights it was a god send). breakfast was plentiful and ranged from cereal to toast/pastries/bagels and two hot items daily. i would say it was more then enough for me and my family and after all it complimentary, if you want large varied gutbuster breakfasts pay your $4 and go to the ponderosa. The pool was always clean with pleanty of towles and sunloungers available. the loction is a little bit out of the main i-drive drag but i found this a positive as using universal boulevard compared to i-drive was much much quicker. the room was cleaned immaculatly daily and bedding changed upon request. Overall i would rate this hotel as the best value for money i have ever stayed in. The beds were sooooooo comfortable although a little small. if you want plush luxury then this isnt the place but honest down to earth clean living at a very very good price it cant be beaten (we paid Â£520 for three weeks for 2 adults and 2 children)

Reviews.Title: “hampton inn universal blvd on of the best”
Reviews.Author: Tiggs47
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hampton Inn was from 24th Aug till 10th Sept 07 in fact i'm still here and i have to say myself and my partner and daughter just love it here. From the moment we got here the staff are friendly and always great us with a smile and a hello by name. The breakfast is far from basic it is very good and always well stocked with fresh fruit and ceral and bagles and muffins and fresh coffee and orange juice. In the UK we would pay quite a bit for a breakfast like that and we have stayed at some hotels that do complementry breakfasts and we could not bare to look at them let alone eat them. Also we find the rooms here very clean and well stocked with thing like shampoo and conditioner and shower gel and mouth wash and plenty of clean towels. If we need a taxi the girls on reception are alway happy to call us one and make sure we dont get ripped off. I really cant fault our stay at the Hampton Inn we will be comming back here to stay. Carolyn Fryer UK

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Orlando Convention Center was by far an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SatisfiedNy
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived the service level of this hotel was superior compared to many hotel stays in Orlando. Breakfast has a great variety and it's free along with many other items that other hotels charge for. I was able to get coffee any time and not get charged now tell me other hotels has this concept, and free parking too! Every afternoon the staff baked free cookies and they tasted amazing, not because they were free they were quality free cookies. Our room was very nice and the bedding was amazing not to mention I had the best night sleep at this hotel. I travel for a living and I'm away from alot staying at many hotels throughout the United States . I have to say I have never had the level of service ever in other hotels the way I did at the Hampton inn Orlando Convention Center! One of many very satisified guests!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but have stayed in better.”
Reviews.Author: TheBigVe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for a week in mid-Aug and thought the hotel was very good. Had requested a room on a high floor that overlooked the pool, and this was exactly what we got. The room was clean and spacious, although surprisingly didn't have either a safe or a fridge. We had arrived in Orlando in the middle of a heat wave with temperatures being in the mid 90s and really needed somewhere to cool our drinks, lotion, etc. So we ended up having to order a second ice bucket and use them as a makeshift drinks cooler! Not ideal but it did the job. The hotel offers a wide ranging continental breakfast which was very popular with guests, plus the hot drinks machine is available 24/7 (or at least until the vats run out at night). There is also a free internet site by the reception area, which was always available. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The pool is small but clean, and complimentary towels are provided which was useful. Thereâ€™s no poolside bar which is a shame coz in the midday heat it would have been nice and refreshing to down a chilled beer or two! Location wise itâ€™s ideally set. Being on Universal Drive we werenâ€™t situation in the hustle and bustle of International Drive, but were only a few minutes walk from it, and close to several great restaurants and Pointe Orlando! Having got a great deal to stay at the Hampton, and with it being the #1 rated hotel on Trip Advisor, we were very much excited about staying here. All in all it did meet our expectations, but on reflection, although I would try this hotel again, it didnâ€™t surpass other hotels I had stayed at on previous trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: merryman
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the recent negative views, we have just spent a week there last week (aug 19th) and pound for pound this hotel has to be one of the best in Orlando. Yes. there are larger and more up-market hotels in Orlando but they also come with larger and up-market prices, but if you look at the big picture, overall and taking everything into account this has to be the best value hotel , The rooms are clean, the beds very comfortable, no noise,close to i.drive,coffee on tap night and day in lobby,decent and clean although not overlly large pool, excellent staff who couldnt do enough for you, free internet in lobby, breakfast bag to take away if you slept in ,small shop, free safe deposit box. i could go on and on.... I really couldnt find fault with this hotel at all,we didnt really hang around too much with the breakfast, a cup of coffee. piece of fruit and a yogurt did us, but i did see hot sausage and eggs on show with muffins and the like. And you must remember this is complimentary,most hotels dont offer breakfast. The only noise we encounted on our whole stay were the vacuum cleaners in the late morning and throughout the day, they really take the cleaning seriously,they seemed to be cleaning all day,but thats not a bad thing is it? And this is the only hotel ive ever been in anywhere and (ive been about) that has such attention to detail to actually put bows around toilet paper,these people really care about your stay and i would recommend this hotel to any one staying on i .drive. To what am i comparing this report ?.. hotel plaza l,b.v 8/10 $110 per night..lovely hotel doubletree entrance to universal 7/10 $110 per night... nice best western plaza 2/10 $50 per night.......dump hampton inn 9/10 $50 per night.....excellent now you go figure,,,,,,,this is a hotel that is punching above its weight and is an absolute treasure

Reviews.Title: “Going down hill since new coproate management took over.”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: This used to be my favorite hotel in Orlando. I have heard that within the past few months, the hotel has been taken over by another corporate company. When I arrived, I could see this effect. The employess were not as welcoming and were not as enthusiatic about being there. This new company must be about the "bottom line" and only cares about the $ brought in. Yes, I understand this, but in order to achieve this success, you must first sacrifice the "bottom line" for the sake of keeping your employees happy. This will have a domino effect on the way the hotel presents itself to its guests. By noticing this hotel's current demeanor, I must honestly say that I will not go back. I typically stayed there for approximately 25-30 night total per year.

Reviews.Title: “Let's not get carried away folks, just an average hotel, we think”
Reviews.Author: zmn4500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for location. Only about five minutes to Sea World's front steps. A comfortable pillow and bed, fairly clean room, somewhat quiet, but nothing above average. Pool small, but very clean. Breakfast sign in lobby read "quiet" breakfast at 7am, "busy" breakfast at 8am, and "great" breakfast at 9am. We got there at 8:30, eggs dry, sausage about warm, pastries average, coffee hot. Guess we should have waited until 9:00! It's a $90 night stay but not worth much more. And, if you are going to convention center .... we figure you can walk there in only a few minutes ... right across the street practically. No huge complaints, but no above and beyond "gold stars" either. Nice average stay. And incidently, this is right next door to Spring Hill Suites Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: mellieha1978
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a week's stay here and I can highly recommend it. The pool area was clean with towels provided and the breakfast was great as you could get one of their breakfast bags or go into breakfast. There wa always a good selection - fruit, cereal, toast, muffins, cakes, yoghurt, juices and hot drinks. I also liked that you could help yourself to tea, coffe and hot choc all day free of charge. The room was spacious and clean - it would have been nice to have a balcony - but that wasn't a real issue. You are minutes away from Johnny Rockets, TGI's, Pizza Hut, Subway, Bahama Breeze, Walgreens, Race Rock etc... and also its in a great location for catching both lines on the I ride trolley. The reception staff were polite and courteous but were not really overly helpful. There is the new IMAX cinema about a 5 min walk away. I would definately recommend this hotel to friends and family. The shuttle service to disney and universal is pretty much non existant and expensive - I recommend a taxi or i ride if you haven't got a car. If you go to City Walk - a taxi home is only around 8 $.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: dundeesfinest
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hampton in Sept. 06 with our 9 year old son and 3 other family members. This was our second stay in the hotel having visited it the previous year. We were delighted to see that the staff recognised us from the previous year. The hotel had been refurbished and was looking better than ever. The breakfast is all you could ask for and the levels of service are great, from the reception desk to the maids. The hotel's quiet location is a retreat from the hurly burly of international drive and is only a very short walk away from places like Bahama Breeze, TGI Fidays, Pizza Hut, Olive Garden, Ming Court and others we could mention (can you tell we like our food!) Overall a great place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: ybool
Reviews.Content: After having a terrible experience at another near-by hotel, we moved to the Hampton after reading it's review on TripAdvisor. The quality of the property and room, and the friendliness and cheerfulness of the staff were just what we needed to see. We walked in and got a rate that was within a few dollars of the best rate we saw on Expedia, and for a better room. One bonus is defiantely the free breakfast, which I strongly recommend if you are travelling with the family- that alone will save you a lot of money here in tourist country. I can recommend this hotel with no hesitation based on our stay- close to everything, very comfortable rooms, great price and free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Brookeschiavi
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Arrived on July 4th and stayed a week, with two rooms for our family. Within 10 minutes of our arrival the hotel furnished us with a small refrigerator for a family member to safely store their insulin. During our stay my wife had a birthday on 7/7, a Saturday when normally cookies aren't put out. However, upon learning it was her birthday and how much she loved their cookies, they sent out and had a dozen cookies brought up to our room as her 'present'. She was thrilled by their thoughtfulness. We loved their duvet/cover and hypo-allergenic pillows so much we asked where we could purchase them and were given the website. We ordered them and they were delivered the day after we got home. If you've never stayed there and slept with their bedding you'll purchase them as well (Very reasonable rates). The high speed internet connection worked extremely well. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. As well, the hotel is located in a safe area and very quiet. We booked through their website and got a Kingsize bed/sofa room for $114 per room. Try that price in Orlando! Especially for the quality. The breakfast choices are excellent and there are several food delivery businesses (including TGIF) which had reasonable prices and good food. Can't think of a single negative thing to say. All of our needs were met including higher class amenities and toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: meluwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week in June. I was so pleased with the free breakfast every morning. It got us off to a good start with all of the delicious selections of foods. Also, throughout the day there were always fruit bowls to grab an apple or banana and fresh, delicious chocolate chip cookies out as well every afternoon. There was also a cake one day to enjoy. The pool was small, quiet and relaxing. The location of the hotel was awesome. It is on the nice end of I Drive. Right behind the hotel was minature golf, plenty of places to eat, a Wal-greens, shopping, Wonder Works...this was all within walking distance. Most attractions were within a 5 min drive or so depending on traffic. The beds were so comfortable. When I got home, it felt like I was sleeping on a concrete block because I got pretty spoiled there I guess. Room was always cleaned and front desk staff very nice. The only negative thing I can say is it wasn't very suiting for our rambunctious 10 yr old. He was wanting to be loud at the pool, in the halls and in the room and we were constantly saying shhh because it seemed the other guest were all business oriented or just older and more conservative. Meaning, for kids wanting to run around and just be kids, they will have to be a little more disciplined here. All and all though it was fantastic. And our son thought the trade-off for being quiet balanced out with the napkins full of cookies he would swipe every eveing! Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Fifeac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks last October. Great value for money, very helpful staff and very comfortable. Free breakfast is a bonus with a varied selection all you can eat. There is also free and unlimited hot drinks day and night. We found the hotel to be quiet and had no problem getting a good nights sleep. The beds are fantastically comfortable and large. The pool is small but was always quiet and great for a quick cooling dip. The hotel is in a quiet location at the better end of International Drive. Highly recommended. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen-Mark
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Florida having stayed one week in Orlando and one week in Boca Raton, Palm Beach County. My only regret is that I did not book a Hampton Inn in both locations. (see my review of Boca Raton Plaza Hotel & Suites) The Hampton Inn is perfect in every way - staff helpful and friendly, excellent hotel services and spotlessly clean. The one thing I have to give special mention to was the bed - the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Gorgeous pillows and duvets too. The location is close to Universal Studios, Pointe Orlando Mall and Wet 'n Wild and about 20 minutes drive to Disney. A shuttle service is available for $6. Premium outlets is also very close. The hotel is on Universal Blvd but if you walk through the carpark at the back of the hotel you are on International Drive. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance and TGI Fridays do room service if you dont was to walk 3 minutes! Complementary tea and coffee are available 24 hours and some nights they have free movies and popcorn in the lobby. I could go on and on about this great Hotel but lets just say there is nothing I could fault with it. I just regret not having booked a Hampton Inn for the second week of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The other reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: lakecity211
Reviews.Content: The other reviews were right. This is an excellent place right behind the convention center and International Drive. The hotel was busy with other guests who many had noisy unruly kids, but we never heard any noise from our room. Our room was so quiet we had to turn the T.V. on for noise. The beds were excellent just like the beds that are in expensive luxury hotels. The shower head had adjustable settings and excellent water pressure. The toilet even had excellent water pressure. The breakfast was great for a hotel breakfast which consisted of eggs and other hot items along with fruit and juices. Even though the breakfast area was always busy it was fully stocked. I am very particular and notice every little tiny detail. The room and bathroom both were very clean with no dust or partials anywhere however; the bathroom did have some hairs on the floor. The drain in the bathroom was slow and I reported this at checkout. The clerk immediately called someone on the radio which I assumed it was being taken care of. Also, Hampton inns normally have cookies in the afternoon. Since it was the weekend they didnâ€™t have any so we had to go out for ice cream at Cold Stone Creamery instead which we have not done since we moved. The above details are so minor that it wouldnâ€™t be fair for me not to give this hotel a perfect rating especially for what we got for the price. These details are too minor to prevent me from staying again and recommending it to others. We will definitely stay here the next time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAWhereToNext
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Hampton Inn in the last few months. I am usually a bed and breakfast person, but sometimes you just need to stay in a hotel. The Hampton Inn is a great place to stay and in my opinion just as nice as those "fancy" hotels. Hilton has really done the right thing with this hotel group. The Hampton Inn Convention Center was clean, the staff nice and the breakfast was pretty good. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms spacious and brightly lit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous beds at Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Floridashirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending 2 nights at the Hampton inn. I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a clean, well appointed hotel with an excellent breakfast service. We found all the staff very friendly, polite and helpful. Check in was a breeze, even after travelling for over 13 hours before we got there. After a quick shower in an immaculate bathroom we headed out for something to eat. After our evening meal we were totally exhausted and decided to head back to the hotel for an early night. we had read on T.A. about how comfy the beds were and we were not disapointed. There is a choice of pillows and the beds are an absolute dream (excuse the pun), The breakfast selection was very nice and everything was freshly replenished on a regular basis. People who moan about a poor selection should maybe look at what they eat at home each morning and then they will maybe realise that the majority of people have the same thing every morning day in and day out without thinking it odd. The pool looked very clean and inviting but as the weather was not on our side we didnt try it out so i can't comment on it more than this. We then travelled down to The Key's for a few days and on our return to the area decided to stay at a different hotel to get a more balanced idea of what accomodation in the area is like. The next hotel we stayed at was on equal par to the Hampton in most things apart from the beds, I don't think any hotel will match those amazing beds. Overall we totally enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone and on our next visit to Florida this hotel will be top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: like2travel1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending three nights here and were very impressed. The hotel is ideally located on quiet Universal Blvd, just a short block and easy walk from many restaurants, shops and attractions on busy International Drive. The hotel is fairly new and was completely renovated top to bottom about a year ago, which gave us the impression it was brand-new. Rooms - Our room was large, very nicely decorated, and included all the latest Hampton Inn amenities. Our king-size bed had the latest plush-style mattress with comforter-style blanket and both firm and soft pillows, and was very comfortable. Our bath area had plenty of large fluffy towels. Everything was vey clean, including the upholstered sofa and chair cushions. Drapes were the light-blocking type, making our room dark for a good night's sleep. Staff - All of the staff were very pleasant on both the evening shifts and morning shifts, and they were all very knowledgable about the area and directions to attractions. They were also knowledgable about restaurants in the area. Breakfast - The breakfast area is just off the lobby and nicely arranged. Even with the hotel full all three nights, we and other guests had no problem finding a table. The breakfast selections were good, like we have come to expect at other nice Hampton Inns, and included two hot items every day. These hot items were different each day of our stay, which was very thoughtful of management. The breakfast area had 2-3 staff people on duty every day keeping everything replenished and clean. Other - The hotel is extremely quiet. Several high school bus groups were staying at the hotel while we were there and we did not hear any noise whatsoever from any of them. We were also highly impressed with the way the staff treated us. The hotel is near the Convention Center and guests are a mix of both business people and tourists. Although this was our first stay at this hotel, we were treated as regulars and made to feel our business was truly appreciated. We very definitely plan to stay here on future trips to Orlando and highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosyred
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending a week at the Hampton Inn & Convention Centre, Universal Boulevard, Orlando, and would certainly return there again - in fact we hope to in September! The hotel was walking distance of International Drive. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The staff polite and friendly. And the complementary continental breakfast superb as was the outdoor swimming pool. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone going to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Skipper_Stu
Reviews.Content: Booked through Travelcity UK. have stayed in lots of IDrive hotels and this is without doubt the nicest and the best. Free breakfast saved us family of 4 a load of money. Hotel was squeaky clean, staff were spot on, the pool, although small, was always quiet and loungers were free. It was only a matter of 2 minutes to walk thru the car parks to ID. Free news papers, only gripe, would like to have had a bar to retire to sometimes although we found out halfway thru the stay that we could take cold beers etc into the dining area to watch the wide screen TV. All in all if going to ID again will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: reg
Reviews.Content: As relayed by many other reviewers there are only positive things to say about this Hampton. Ideal location, easy to get around using International Drive by pass or Universal Blvd. We were at the Walt Disney World parks and back in our room within 20 to 25 minutes. You could easily walk to International Drive and the restaurants at Pointe Orlando. Our room was immaculate as was the entire hotel. Friendly, welcoming staff. You would always get a "hi "as you walked by the front desk. The hotel was fully booked during our stay but it was still quiet. The guests were a mixture of business people for activities at the convention centre and vacationers though not many with young children. Despite a busy time the breakfast area was well serviced with all food items constantly being refreshed. There was a well maintained pool area as well as exercise room. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: neonitrix
Reviews.Content: We Stayed here in september 2006 - hotel rooms were great close to international drive and free breakfast was a bonus would stay here again no problems
